intro: Melanthera oxycarpha, commonly known as the sharp-lobed ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy purple to pink flower heads. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and its flowers are typically arranged in dense, rounded clusters. Melanthera oxycarpha thrives in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and marshes. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
